globalEvents.name: Mission Briefing
globalEvents.eventText:
You return to Haven, responding to the proximity alarms signaling incoming Imperials. The settlement leader, Benex, performs quite well, establishing a defensive perimeter before even you arrived. “I need you to guard the control center for our automated defenses,” he shouts into comlink between the sounds of detonations and blaster fire.

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 8, Defense: 1 black die).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.

eventActions.theText: {-} Imperial figures will attack doors if this is the shortest, direct way to their targets.
Three security consoles coordinate the automated defenses.

entityProperties.name: Terminal North
entityProperties.theText:
The terminal hums and beeps as it controls Haven's automated security systems.

{-} When adjacent to the terminal, a Slicer or Slicer Commander can discard it when instructed.

entityProperties.name: Terminal Middle
entityProperties.theText:
The terminal hums and beeps as it controls Haven's automated security systems.

{-} When adjacent to the terminal, a Slicer or Slicer Commander can discard it when instructed.

entityProperties.name: Terminal South
entityProperties.theText:
The terminal hums and beeps as it controls Haven's automated security systems.

{-} When adjacent to the terminal, a Slicer or Slicer Commander can discard it when instructed.

eventActions.theText: The control center is old and dilapidated. There are gaps in the wall that the Imperial forces could use to force open another entrance.

entityProperties.name: Gap NW
entityProperties.theText:
An old gap in the defenses could be used by the Imperials to enter the control center.

{-} This is the North-West Gap.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent gaps. If a space contains 3 or more neutral mission tokens, that space is an active deployment point.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the Empire increases its efforts on one of the gaps.

entityProperties.name: Gap N
entityProperties.theText:
An old gap in the defenses could be used by the Imperials to enter the control center.

{-} This is the North Gap.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent gaps. If a space contains 3 or more neutral mission tokens, that space is an active deployment point.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the Empire increases its efforts on one of the gaps.

entityProperties.name: Gap SW
entityProperties.theText:
An old gap in the defenses could be used by the Imperials to enter the control center.

{-} {-} This is the South-West Gap.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent gaps. If a space contains 3 or more neutral mission tokens, that space is an active deployment point.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the Empire increases its efforts on one of the gaps.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent gaps. If a space contains 3 or more neutral mission tokens, that space is an active deployment point.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the Empire increases its efforts on one of the gaps.
No sooner do you arrive than the Imperials assault the control center in massive numbers, blasting the fortified structure at every angle and attempting to breach the walls.
The Imperial forces are led by a group of elite slicer experts, ready to disable Haven's automated defenses.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{A} Move 3 toward the closest terminal.
{A} Move 1 to discard an adjacent terminal.
{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 3 or less that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.

{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 3 or less that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.

{A} Move 1 to discard an adjacent terminal.
{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 6 or less that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.

eventActions.theText:
{-} When adjacent to a terminal, a Slicer or Slicer Commander can discard it when instructed.
{-} Slicers cannot be defeated. When they would be defeated, set their figure aside instead.
{-} The Slicer Commander can be defeated as usual.

You ready your weapons, determined to defent the control room for as long as possible.

{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 8.
{-} The Rebels lose when all terminals are discarded.
Defend the security consoles. Consoles online: &Terminals online&/3

{-} Doors are locked. An Imperial figure can attack a door (Health: 8, Defense: 1 black die).
{-} A door adjacent to a Rebel figure does not block his movement, line of sight, adjacency, or counting spaces.
{-} Neutral mission tokens represent gaps. If a space contains 3 or more neutral mission tokens, that space is an active deployment point.
{-} At the start of each Status Phase, the Empire increases its efforts on one of the gaps.
{-} When adjacent to a terminal, a Slicer or Slicer Commander can discard it when instructed.
{-} Slicers cannot be defeated. When they would be defeated, set their figure aside instead.
{-} The Slicer Commander can be defeated as usual.
{-} The Rebels win at the end of Round 8.
{-} The Rebels lose when all terminals are discarded.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels win
globalEvents.eventText:
You continue to hold against the impending Imperial onslaught, defending the control consoles from wave after wave of troopers.

Finally, Benex arrives with his own forces, cutting into the Imperial flank. Outmaneuvered and still contending with automated defenses, the Imperial forces fall into a retreat.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Each hero receives 2 XP. Heroes receive 200 credits per hero. 
{-} Place Story Mission card “Return to Echo Base” into play.

eventActions.theText:
Once the smoke clears from the battle, you meet with Benex, who scowls. “You and your people need to leave,” he tells you. “They'll come again, and we wont be able to fight them. Do you understand me? I'm happy to help you, but I have my own people to think about.”

You spend a fair amount of time arguing with him. Eventually, he relents, saying that you and your people will be permitted to stay... for now, at least.

{-} If all doors were destroyed, increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this. Otherwise, heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: End of Mission - Rebels lose
globalEvents.eventText:
Despite your best efforts, the Imperials destroy the control center, allowing their forces to pour into the settlement.

The ensuing battle is long and vicious. Though you eventually manage to drive the enemy soldiers away, more than half of the settlement lies in ruin.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.
{-} Place Story Mission card “Return to Echo Base” into play.

eventActions.theText:
Once the smoke clears from the battle, you meet with Benex, who scowls. “You and your people need to leave,” he tells you. “They'll come again, and we wont be able to fight them. Do you understand me? I'm happy to help you, but I have my own people to think about.”

You spend a fair amount of time arguing with him. Eventually, he relents, saying that you and your people will be permitted to stay... for now, at least.

{-} If all doors were destroyed, increase the threat level of the next mission (and only the next mission) by 1. During the Rebel Upgrade stage, the Rebel players can decide to spend 50 credits per hero to prevent this. Otherwise, heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

globalEvents.name: Destroy Door NE
globalEvents.eventText: The door collapses under the Imperial assault.

globalEvents.name: DP North Active
globalEvents.eventText:
There's a loud bang, and ice-caked rubble is blasted inside. The Empire has broken through the walls.

{-} The North Gap is now an active deployment point.

globalEvents.name: DP North-West Active
globalEvents.eventText:
There's a loud bang, and ice-caked rubble is blasted inside. The Empire has broken through the walls.

{-} The North-West Gap is now an active deployment point.

globalEvents.name: DP South-West Active

There's a loud bang, and ice-caked rubble is blasted inside. The Empire has broken through the walls.

{-} The South-West Gap is now an active deployment point.

globalEvents.name: Terminal discarded North
globalEvents.eventText:
The Imperial slicer makes quick work of the terminal, which immediately powers down. But you won't give up this easily.

{-} Each hero may move up to 2 spaces (4 spaces if that hero has 2 activation tokens). Then, each hero chooses 1 of the following:
— Become Focused.
— Gain 3 movement points.

eventActions.theText: Is Slicer A set aside?

globalEvents.name: Slicer A set aside
globalEvents.eventText: End this activation immediately without resolving any instructions.

eventActions.theText: Is Slicer B set aside?

globalEvents.name: Slicer B set aside
globalEvents.eventText: End this activation immediately without resolving any instructions.

globalEvents.name: Man the Barricades
globalEvents.eventText: More Imperial forces rush in, carrying a huge blaster cannon.

globalEvents.name: Another Push Question
globalEvents.eventText: A glimpse of external monitors shows no end to the flood of Imperial troops.

eventActions.theText: Is there at least 1 boon in the heroes' play area?

globalEvents.name: Another Push Yes
globalEvents.eventText: Your efforts so far have been successful. There are not as many Imperials as you feared.

globalEvents.name: Another Push No
globalEvents.eventText: The number of Imperial troops is almost uncountable.

globalEvents.name: Hostile Wildlife
globalEvents.eventText: A crash resounds in the nearby corridor, and a lumbering, fur-covered creature with vicious claws comes into view. It would appear that the commotion of the battle has disturbed local wildlife.

globalEvents.name: Back and Forth
globalEvents.eventText:
The Imperial forces keep pressing forward, but you fight them back again and again. A brief moment of respite might allow you to turn the tide of the battle.

{-} Each hero may interrupt to perform a move. Then, each hero on or adjacent to a space containing 2 or more neutral mission tokens may interact to perform a {K} test. If the test is successful, discard 1 neutral mission token from that space.

eventActions.theText: Was a token removed from the North Gap?

Was a token removed from the North-West Gap?
Was a token removed from the South-West Gap?
Was a token removed from the South-West Gap?

globalEvents.name: DP Inactive North
globalEvents.eventText: The North Gap is no active deployment point.

globalEvents.name: DP Inactive Northwest
globalEvents.eventText: The North-West Gap is no active deployment point.

globalEvents.name: DP Inactive Southwest
globalEvents.eventText: The South-West Gap is no active deployment point.

globalEvents.name: Press the Advantage
globalEvents.eventText:
“Now’s our chance!” you hear the commanders shout. “We've beaten them down. Move! Move!”

{-} Slicers and the Slicer Commander receive additional movement points.

eventActions.theText:
{A} Move 4 toward the closest terminal.
{A} Move 2 to discard an adjacent terminal.
{A} ORDER: Another Imperial figure with a figure cost of 3 or less that can perform an attack attacks {rebel}.

globalEvents.name: Slicers redeployed
globalEvents.eventText:
More members of the Imperial slicer squad rush in.

{-} Place any Slicers set aside on the gap containing 3 or more neutral mission tokens that is closest to a terminal. If there are no gaps containing 3 or more neutral mission tokens, place the Slicers on the green highlighted space.
